trans-unit.source: Install and set up tools for authoring in GitHub
trans-unit.target: Install and set up tools for authoring in GitHub

trans-unit.source: Tools and steps to get set up for authoring Azure content in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: Tools and steps to get set up for authoring Azure content in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Install and set up tools for authoring in GitHub
trans-unit.target: Install and set up tools for authoring in GitHub

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in this article to set up tools for contributing to the Azure technical documentation.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in this article to set up tools for contributing to the Azure technical documentation.

trans-unit.source: Casual and occasional contributors probably can use the GitHub UI described in step 2.
trans-unit.target: Casual and occasional contributors probably can use the GitHub UI described in step 2.

trans-unit.source: If you're unfamiliar with Git, you might want to review some Git terminology: [https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary).
trans-unit.target: If you're unfamiliar with Git, you might want to review some Git terminology: [https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary).

trans-unit.source: In addition, this StackOverflow thread contains a glossary of Git terms you'll encounter in this set of steps: [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7076164/terminology-used-by-git](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7076164/terminology-used-by-git)
trans-unit.target: In addition, this StackOverflow thread contains a glossary of Git terms you'll encounter in this set of steps: [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7076164/terminology-used-by-git](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7076164/terminology-used-by-git)

trans-unit.source: Create a GitHub account and set up your profile
trans-unit.target: Create a GitHub account and set up your profile

trans-unit.source: To contribute to the Azure technical content, you'll need a [GitHub](http://www.github.com) account.
trans-unit.target: To contribute to the Azure technical content, you'll need a [GitHub](http://www.github.com) account.

trans-unit.source: If you are a Microsoft contributor, you need to set up your GitHub account so you're clearly identified as a Microsoft employee.
trans-unit.target: If you are a Microsoft contributor, you need to set up your GitHub account so you're clearly identified as a Microsoft employee.

trans-unit.source: Set up your profile as follows:
trans-unit.target: Set up your profile as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Profile picture**: a picture of you (required)
trans-unit.target: **Profile picture**: a picture of you (required)

trans-unit.source: **Name**: your first and last name (required)
trans-unit.target: **Name**: your first and last name (required)

trans-unit.source: **Email**: your Microsoft email address (required)
trans-unit.target: **Email**: your Microsoft email address (required)

trans-unit.source: **Company**: Microsoft Corporation (required)
trans-unit.target: **Company**: Microsoft Corporation (required)

trans-unit.source: **Location**: list your location (required)
trans-unit.target: **Location**: list your location (required)

trans-unit.source: Your profile should resemble this profile:
trans-unit.target: Your profile should resemble this profile:

trans-unit.source: Sign up for Disqus
trans-unit.target: Sign up for Disqus

trans-unit.source: Every published Azure technical article has a comment stream provided by the Disqus service.
trans-unit.target: Every published Azure technical article has a comment stream provided by the Disqus service.

trans-unit.source: Discus logo
trans-unit.target: Discus logo

trans-unit.source: If you are a Microsoft employee, and if you are the author of or a contributor to an article, you need to sign up for Disqus so you can participate in the comment stream for the article.
trans-unit.target: If you are a Microsoft employee, and if you are the author of or a contributor to an article, you need to sign up for Disqus so you can participate in the comment stream for the article.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for an account at [http://www.disqus.com/](http://www.disqus.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign up for an account at [http://www.disqus.com/](http://www.disqus.com/)

trans-unit.source: Fill out your profile as follows:
trans-unit.target: Fill out your profile as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Full Name**: your full name as displayed in your Microsoft address book listing, plus the bracketed info, which is your alias plus @MSFT.
trans-unit.target: **Full Name**: your full name as displayed in your Microsoft address book listing, plus the bracketed info, which is your alias plus @MSFT.

trans-unit.source: Format: *First Last [alias@MSFT]*
trans-unit.target: Format: *First Last [alias@MSFT]*

trans-unit.source: **Location**: Your location
trans-unit.target: **Location**: Your location

trans-unit.source: **Short Bio**: Your title
trans-unit.target: **Short Bio**: Your title

trans-unit.source: Determine whether you really need to follow the rest of these steps
trans-unit.target: Determine whether you really need to follow the rest of these steps

trans-unit.source: You might not need to follow all the steps in this article.
trans-unit.target: You might not need to follow all the steps in this article.

trans-unit.source: It depends on the sort of content contribution you want or need to make.
trans-unit.target: It depends on the sort of content contribution you want or need to make.

trans-unit.source: Submit a text-only change to an existing article
trans-unit.target: Submit a text-only change to an existing article

trans-unit.source: If you only need or want to make textual updates to an existing article, you probably don't need to follow the rest of the steps.
trans-unit.target: If you only need or want to make textual updates to an existing article, you probably don't need to follow the rest of the steps.

trans-unit.source: You can use GitHub's web-based markdown editor to submit your changes.
trans-unit.target: You can use GitHub's web-based markdown editor to submit your changes.

trans-unit.source: Just click the GitHub link in the article you want to modify:
trans-unit.target: Just click the GitHub link in the article you want to modify:

trans-unit.source: GitHub profile example
trans-unit.target: GitHub profile example

trans-unit.source: Then, click the edit icon in the GitHub version of the article
trans-unit.target: Then, click the edit icon in the GitHub version of the article

trans-unit.source: GitHub profile example
trans-unit.target: GitHub profile example

trans-unit.source: That opens the easy-to-use web editor that makes it easy to submit changes.
trans-unit.target: That opens the easy-to-use web editor that makes it easy to submit changes.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to follow the other steps in this article.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to follow the other steps in this article.

trans-unit.source: All other changes
trans-unit.target: All other changes

trans-unit.source: You need to install the tools if you want to make any of the following sorts of changes:
trans-unit.target: You need to install the tools if you want to make any of the following sorts of changes:

trans-unit.source: Major changes to an article
trans-unit.target: Major changes to an article

trans-unit.source: Create and publish a new article
trans-unit.target: Create and publish a new article

trans-unit.source: Add new images or update images
trans-unit.target: Add new images or update images

trans-unit.source: Update an article over a period of days without publishing changes each of those days
trans-unit.target: Update an article over a period of days without publishing changes each of those days

trans-unit.source: Go to the next section!
trans-unit.target: Go to the next section!

trans-unit.source: Permissions in GitHub
trans-unit.target: Permissions in GitHub

trans-unit.source: Anybody with a GitHub account can contribute to Azure technical content through our public repository at [https://github.com/Azure/azure-content](https://github.com/Azure/azure-content).
trans-unit.target: Anybody with a GitHub account can contribute to Azure technical content through our public repository at [https://github.com/Azure/azure-content](https://github.com/Azure/azure-content).

trans-unit.source: No special permissions are required.
trans-unit.target: No special permissions are required.

trans-unit.source: If you are a Microsoft employee working on Azure content, you should work in our private content repository, azure-content-pr.
trans-unit.target: If you are a Microsoft employee working on Azure content, you should work in our private content repository, azure-content-pr.

trans-unit.source: Visit [http://aka.ms/azuregithub](http://aka.ms/azuregithub) to obtain the read permissions that will let you make contributions through the private repo - click **Join a Team**, and join **azure-content-read**.
trans-unit.target: Visit [http://aka.ms/azuregithub](http://aka.ms/azuregithub) to obtain the read permissions that will let you make contributions through the private repo - click **Join a Team**, and join **azure-content-read**.

trans-unit.source: Install Git for Windows
trans-unit.target: Install Git for Windows

trans-unit.source: Install Git for Windows from [http://git-scm.com/download/win](http://git-scm.com/download/win).
trans-unit.target: Install Git for Windows from [http://git-scm.com/download/win](http://git-scm.com/download/win).

trans-unit.source: This download installs the Git version control system, and it installs Git Bash, the command-line app that you will use to interact with your local Git repository.
trans-unit.target: This download installs the Git version control system, and it installs Git Bash, the command-line app that you will use to interact with your local Git repository.

trans-unit.source: You can accept the default settings; if you want the commands to be available within the Windows command line, select the option that enables it.
trans-unit.target: You can accept the default settings; if you want the commands to be available within the Windows command line, select the option that enables it.

trans-unit.source: (Note: This is not the same as "Github for Windows".
trans-unit.target: (Note: This is not the same as "Github for Windows".

trans-unit.source: "Github for Windows" is a different GUI-based tool that will also work if you want to read up on yourself.
trans-unit.target: "Github for Windows" is a different GUI-based tool that will also work if you want to read up on yourself.

trans-unit.source: [https://windows.github.com/](https://windows.github.com/))
trans-unit.target: [https://windows.github.com/](https://windows.github.com/))

trans-unit.source: Enable two-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Enable two-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: You have to enable two factor authentication (2FA) on your GitHub account if you are working in the private content repository.
trans-unit.target: You have to enable two factor authentication (2FA) on your GitHub account if you are working in the private content repository.

trans-unit.source: It's required in the private repository.
trans-unit.target: It's required in the private repository.

trans-unit.source: To enable this, follow the instructions in both the following GitHub help topics:
trans-unit.target: To enable this, follow the instructions in both the following GitHub help topics:

trans-unit.source: About Two-Factor Authentication
trans-unit.target: About Two-Factor Authentication

trans-unit.source: Creating an access token for command-line use
trans-unit.target: Creating an access token for command-line use

trans-unit.source: After you enable 2FA, you have to enter the access token instead of your GitHub password at the command prompt when you try to access a GitHub repository from the command line.
trans-unit.target: After you enable 2FA, you have to enter the access token instead of your GitHub password at the command prompt when you try to access a GitHub repository from the command line.

trans-unit.source: The access token is not the authentication code that you get in a text message when you set up 2FA.
trans-unit.target: The access token is not the authentication code that you get in a text message when you set up 2FA.

trans-unit.source: It's a long string that looks something like this: fdd3b7d3d4f0d2bb2cd3d58dba54bd6bafcd8dee.
trans-unit.target: It's a long string that looks something like this: fdd3b7d3d4f0d2bb2cd3d58dba54bd6bafcd8dee.

trans-unit.source: A few notes about this:
trans-unit.target: A few notes about this:

trans-unit.source: When you create your access token, save it in a text file to make it readily accessible when you need it.
trans-unit.target: When you create your access token, save it in a text file to make it readily accessible when you need it.

trans-unit.source: Later, when you need to paste the token, know there are two ways to paste in the command line:
trans-unit.target: Later, when you need to paste the token, know there are two ways to paste in the command line:

trans-unit.source: Click the icon in the upper left corner of the command line window>Edit>Paste.
trans-unit.target: Click the icon in the upper left corner of the command line window>Edit>Paste.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the icon in the upper left corner of the window and click Properties>Options>QuickEdit Mode.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the icon in the upper left corner of the window and click Properties>Options>QuickEdit Mode.

trans-unit.source: This configures the command line so you can paste by right-clicking in the command line window.
trans-unit.target: This configures the command line so you can paste by right-clicking in the command line window.

trans-unit.source: Install a markdown editor
trans-unit.target: Install a markdown editor

trans-unit.source: We author content using simple "markdown" notation in the files, rather than complex "markup" (HTML, XML, etc.).
trans-unit.target: We author content using simple "markdown" notation in the files, rather than complex "markup" (HTML, XML, etc.).

trans-unit.source: So, you'll need to install a markdown editor.
trans-unit.target: So, you'll need to install a markdown editor.

trans-unit.source: **Atom**: Most of us use GitHub's Atom markdown editor: [http://atom.io](http://atom.io).
trans-unit.target: **Atom**: Most of us use GitHub's Atom markdown editor: [http://atom.io](http://atom.io).

trans-unit.source: It does not require a license for business use.
trans-unit.target: It does not require a license for business use.

trans-unit.source: It has spell check.
trans-unit.target: It has spell check.

trans-unit.source: **Notepad**: You can use Notepad for a very lightweight option.
trans-unit.target: **Notepad**: You can use Notepad for a very lightweight option.

trans-unit.source: **Prose**: This is a lightweight, elegant, on-line, and open source markdown editor that offers a preview.
trans-unit.target: **Prose**: This is a lightweight, elegant, on-line, and open source markdown editor that offers a preview.

trans-unit.source: Visit [http://prose.io](http://prose.io) and authorize Prose in your repository.
trans-unit.target: Visit [http://prose.io](http://prose.io) and authorize Prose in your repository.

trans-unit.source: **[Visual Studio Code](https://www.visualstudio.com/products/code-vs.aspx)** - Microsoft's entry in this space.
trans-unit.target: **[Visual Studio Code](https://www.visualstudio.com/products/code-vs.aspx)** - Microsoft's entry in this space.

trans-unit.source: Configure Atom
trans-unit.target: Configure Atom

trans-unit.source: If you use Atom, you'll need to set a few things up.
trans-unit.target: If you use Atom, you'll need to set a few things up.

trans-unit.source: Atom defaults to using 2 spaces for tabs, but Markdown expects 4 spaces.
trans-unit.target: Atom defaults to using 2 spaces for tabs, but Markdown expects 4 spaces.

trans-unit.source: If you leave it at the default of two, your article will look great in local preview, but not when it’s imported into Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you leave it at the default of two, your article will look great in local preview, but not when it’s imported into Azure.

trans-unit.source: So, configure Atom to use 4 spaces - you can find this setting under File>Settings>Editor Settings>Tab Length.
trans-unit.target: So, configure Atom to use 4 spaces - you can find this setting under File>Settings>Editor Settings>Tab Length.

trans-unit.source: You will probably also want to turn on Soft Wrap in this section too, which does the same as "word wrap" in Notepad.
trans-unit.target: You will probably also want to turn on Soft Wrap in this section too, which does the same as "word wrap" in Notepad.

trans-unit.source: To turn on the markdown preview, click Packages>Markdown Preview>Toggle Preview.
trans-unit.target: To turn on the markdown preview, click Packages>Markdown Preview>Toggle Preview.

trans-unit.source: You can use Ctrl-Shift-M to toggle the preview HTML view.
trans-unit.target: You can use Ctrl-Shift-M to toggle the preview HTML view.

trans-unit.source: Fork the repository and copy it to your computer
trans-unit.target: Fork the repository and copy it to your computer

trans-unit.source: Create a fork of the repository in GitHub - go to the top-right of the page and click the Fork button.
trans-unit.target: Create a fork of the repository in GitHub - go to the top-right of the page and click the Fork button.

trans-unit.source: If prompted, select your account as the location where the fork should be created.
trans-unit.target: If prompted, select your account as the location where the fork should be created.

trans-unit.source: This creates a copy of the repository within your Git Hub account.
trans-unit.target: This creates a copy of the repository within your Git Hub account.

trans-unit.source: Generally speaking, technical writers and program managers need to fork azure-content-pr, the private repo.
trans-unit.target: Generally speaking, technical writers and program managers need to fork azure-content-pr, the private repo.

trans-unit.source: Community contributors need to fork azure-content, the public repo.
trans-unit.target: Community contributors need to fork azure-content, the public repo.

trans-unit.source: You only need to fork one time; after your first setup, if you want to copy your fork to another computer, you only have to run the commands that follow in this section to copy the repo to your computer.
trans-unit.target: You only need to fork one time; after your first setup, if you want to copy your fork to another computer, you only have to run the commands that follow in this section to copy the repo to your computer.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to create forks of both repositories, you will need to create a fork for each repository.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to create forks of both repositories, you will need to create a fork for each repository.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Personal Access Token that you got from [https://github.com/settings/applications#personal-access-tokens](https://github.com/settings/applications#personal-access-tokens).
trans-unit.target: Copy the Personal Access Token that you got from [https://github.com/settings/applications#personal-access-tokens](https://github.com/settings/applications#personal-access-tokens).

trans-unit.source: You can accept the default permissions for the token.
trans-unit.target: You can accept the default permissions for the token.

trans-unit.source: Save the Personal Access Token in a text file for later reuse.
trans-unit.target: Save the Personal Access Token in a text file for later reuse.

trans-unit.source: Next, copy the repository to your computer with your credentials embedded in the command string.
trans-unit.target: Next, copy the repository to your computer with your credentials embedded in the command string.

trans-unit.source: To do this, open GitBash.
trans-unit.target: To do this, open GitBash.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, enter the following command.
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, enter the following command.

trans-unit.source: This command creates a azure-content(-pr) drectory on your computer.
trans-unit.target: This command creates a azure-content(-pr) drectory on your computer.

trans-unit.source: If you're using the default location, it will be at c:\users
trans-unit.target: If you're using the default location, it will be at c:\users

trans-unit.source: \azure-content(-pr).
trans-unit.target: \azure-content(-pr).

trans-unit.source: Public repo:
trans-unit.target: Public repo:

trans-unit.source: Private repo:
trans-unit.target: Private repo:

trans-unit.source: For example, this clone command could look something like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, this clone command could look something like this:

trans-unit.source: Set remote repository connection and configure credentials
trans-unit.target: Set remote repository connection and configure credentials

trans-unit.source: Create a reference to the root repository by entering these commands.
trans-unit.target: Create a reference to the root repository by entering these commands.

trans-unit.source: This sets up connections to the repository in GitHub so that you can get the latest changes onto your local machine and push your changes back to GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This sets up connections to the repository in GitHub so that you can get the latest changes onto your local machine and push your changes back to GitHub.

trans-unit.source: This command also configures your token locally so that you don't have to enter your name and password each time you try to access the upstream repo and your fork on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This command also configures your token locally so that you don't have to enter your name and password each time you try to access the upstream repo and your fork on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Public repo:
trans-unit.target: Public repo:

trans-unit.source: Private repo:
trans-unit.target: Private repo:

trans-unit.source: This usually takes a while.
trans-unit.target: This usually takes a while.

trans-unit.source: After you do this, you won't have to fork again or enter your credentials again.
trans-unit.target: After you do this, you won't have to fork again or enter your credentials again.

trans-unit.source: You would only have to copy the forks to a local computer again if you set the tools up on another computer.
trans-unit.target: You would only have to copy the forks to a local computer again if you set the tools up on another computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure your user name and email locally
trans-unit.target: Configure your user name and email locally

trans-unit.source: To ensure you are listed correctly as a contributor, you need to configure your user name and email locally in Git.
trans-unit.target: To ensure you are listed correctly as a contributor, you need to configure your user name and email locally in Git.

trans-unit.source: Start Git Bash, and switch into azure-content or azure-content-pr:
trans-unit.target: Start Git Bash, and switch into azure-content or azure-content-pr:

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: Configure your user name so it matches your name as you set it up in your GitHub profile:
trans-unit.target: Configure your user name so it matches your name as you set it up in your GitHub profile:

trans-unit.source: Configure your email so it matches the primary email designated in your GitHub profile; if you're a MSFT employee, it should be your MSFT email address:
trans-unit.target: Configure your email so it matches the primary email designated in your GitHub profile; if you're a MSFT employee, it should be your MSFT email address:

trans-unit.source: Type `git config -l` and review your local settings to ensure the user name and email in the configuration are correct.
trans-unit.target: Type `git config -l` and review your local settings to ensure the user name and email in the configuration are correct.

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Create a local working branch](./git-commands-for-master.md) on your computer so you can start work.

trans-unit.target: Copy [the markdown template](../markdown templates/markdown-template-for-new-articles.md) as the basis for a new article.
